title: Tvvo letters the one being intercepted by the Parliaments forces, which was sent from Sir Hugh Cholmley to captain Gotherick, imployed in the Parliaments service; advising him to quit Wrestle-Castle, or else to secure Captain Carter, and to make himself master of it, and keep it for His Majesties service. The other Captain Gothericks honest advice, in answer to the said Sir Hugh, detesting so treacherous and unworthy an act. Ordered by the Commons in Parliament. That these two letters be forthwith printed and published: H: Elsyinge, Cler. Parl. D: Com.
author: Cholmley, Hugh, Sir, 1600-1657.
notes: "Captain Gothericks honest advice in answer to Sir Hugh Cholmley." -- p. 6-8.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
